Interacting Comfortably with People: Building strong collaborative relationships within the team and stakeholders.

Jupyter Notebook Proficiency: Becoming proficient in using Jupyter Notebook for data analysis and modeling.

job_title: 2024 IT / Cyber Security Graduate Program – Singapore
name_location: NOMURA SINGAPORE LIMITED · Singapore, Singapore  4 days ago  · 19 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Who We Are

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, we service the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through our three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking) and Investment Management.

Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com

About Our Team

IT Security team at Nomura is a global function to effectively detect, defend, and respond to cyber-attacks or incidents that threaten or impact our organisation’s network, systems, information, or core business assets.

We Are a Fast-growing Team That Focuses On

 Cyber governance and risk management – responsible for all the regulatory and compliance requirements in Cyber Security
 Threat intelligence helps identify and map external cyber threats targeting Nomura
 Cyber culture and learning works towards spreading cyber security awareness for the firm on a continuous basis through various programs and channels

About The Program

Being part of our 2-year Graduate Program, you will work in the team to gain in-depth knowledge in various cyber security initiatives across Nomura globally.

You will get the exposure to rotate across the different pillars within IT Security and understand how each pillar works together to make impact to the various parts of Nomura. You will also work on key automation initiatives across multiple disciplines with the guidance and mentorship from experienced IT Security professionals.

About You

At Nomura, our goal is to attract and develop exceptionally talented people who share our passion for individual excellence and our commitment to teamwork. We are looking for individuals with outstanding academic and extra-curricular achievement, who will be able to withstand the rigors of a rapidly changing, demanding but ultimately rewarding environment.

We look for team players who are curious and have a keen interest in Cyber Security and Technology. Other common traits amongst our team are intelligence, curiosity, diligence, integrity and the willingness to thrive under a challenging environment.

Due To The Job Nature, Additional Requirements Are

 Studying in quantitative fields, such as Cyber Security, Computer Science, Data Science, or related disciplines would be an advantage
 Intellectual curiosity to solve real world problems
 Exposure and hands-on experience in executing data analysis using tools such as Python, R, SQL, PowerBI, Tableau etc. is nice to have, but not a must
 Ability to clearly communicate to technical and non-technical audiences
 Versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job

Eligibility

We welcome diversity in our teams and would encourage students from all background and disciplines who are in your final year of study (and be available to commence in July 2024) to apply. Fluency in written and spoken English is required.

Application Deadline

Please apply before 11:55pm, Sunday 31 December 2023 (SGT)

For inquiries, please email campusrecruitingaej@nomura.com

Please note that you can only apply to one opportunity globally per academic year. We review applications on a rolling basis and interviews can be arranged prior to the application deadline. We encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready.
Desired Skills and Experience
Tableau, Data Analysis, Cyber Security, Investment Banking, Risk Management, Targeting, Entrepreneurship, Investment Management, Mentorship, Thought Leadership, PowerBI, SQL, Versatility, Threat Intelligence, Data Science, Security Awareness

Are you passionate about technology and programming, with a knack for solving business challenges on the fly and building relationships with clients?

As an IT Analyst at BioQuest, you'll receive training in emerging technologies such as Robotic Process Automation, Smart Workflow, Intelligent Document Processing, and Machine Learning. You'll work alongside our experienced consultants on client projects, gaining hands-on experience in system design, development, testing, documentation, deployment, and support. name_location: NOMURA SINGAPORE LIMITED · Singapore, Singapore  4 days ago  · 20 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Who We Are

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, we service the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through our three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking) and Investment Management.

Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com

About Our Team

Global Markets Technology (GMIT) is responsible for developing and managing trading, pricing, analytics, and research systems. These systems are used by trading desks across Credit, Rates, FX, Securitized Products, Prime and Equities groups to process trades. Our software is responsible for providing analytics and trading capabilities needed by our traders and clients in a highly complex and dynamic market. Our team has a strong relationship with the trading business and is committed to helping the firm achieve its business goals. The environment provides an ideal place to learn business processes and determine technology solutions to meet the business needs. Depending on the specific role, members of the team interact with technologists, traders or salespeople on a daily basis

About The Program

Being part of our 2-year Graduate Program, you will work in the Global Markets IT (GMIT) division to gain in-depth knowledge in driving the development of pricing, trade capture and risk analytics of various Fixed Income and Currencies products across Nomura Group.

During the Program, you will get the exposure to rotate across the FX, Rates and Credit technology teams and understand how each line of business works together to make impact to the various parts of Nomura. You will also work on key FIC Business initiative across multiple disciplines with the guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals.

About You

At Nomura, our goal is to attract and develop exceptionally talented people who share our passion for individual excellence and our commitment to teamwork. We are looking for individuals with outstanding academic and extra-curricular achievement, who will be able to withstand the rigors of a rapidly changing, demanding but ultimately rewarding environment.

We look for team players who are curious with strong quantitative skills and a keen interest in business and finance. Other common traits amongst our team are intelligence, curiosity, diligence, integrity and the willingness and capability to thrive under a challenging environment.

Due To The Job Nature, Additional Requirements Are

 Studying in Computer Science or related disciplines would be advantage
 Exposure & hands-on experience in Front-end Development experience using React/React Native.
 Understanding of other UI frameworks such as Angular, View, Node JS will be added advantage
 Exposure to SQL/RDBMS will be added advantage
 Intellectual curiosity to solve data driven problems
 Ability to understand complex business and data systems
 Ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
 Versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job

Eligibility

We welcome diversity in our teams and would encourage students from all background and disciplines who are in your final year of study (and be available to commence in July 2024) to apply. Fluency in written and spoken English is required.

Application Deadline

Please apply before 11:55pm, Sunday 31 December 2023 (SGT)

For inquiries, please email campusrecruitingaej@nomura.com

Please note that you can only apply to one opportunity globally per academic year. We review applications on a rolling basis and interviews can be arranged prior to the application deadline. We encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready.
Desired Skills and Experience
Interpersonal Skills, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Technology Solutions, SQL, Python, Writing, Communication Skills, Angular, Web Applications, Team Player, Databases, Software Development

name_location: HUMMINGBIRD BIOSCIENCE PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  3 weeks ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Intern, Shiny App Developer - Hummingbird Bioscience

Full-time internship – Singapore based location

About Hummingbird Bioscience

Hummingbird Bioscience is a data-driven precision biotherapeutics team discovering and developing transformative biologic medicines for hard-to-treat diseases. The Hummingbird Bioscience model combines computational and systems biology, wet lab drug discovery in a multi-disciplinary, collaborative environment spanning initial discovery through clinical development. We harness this integrated approach across target identification and patient selection, enabling our team to increase the efficiency of translating novel scientific insights while reducing the inherent risk in drug discovery and development. At Hummingbird Bioscience, our commitment to rigorous science, teamwork, and intellectual integrity underpins our passion to accelerate the journey of new drugs from concept to clinic.

Our highly experienced teams in the US, Australia and Singapore span antibody discovery, pharmacology, production and clinical development. For more information, please visit www.hummingbirdbioscience.com, and follow Hummingbird Bioscience on LinkedIn and Twitter.

About The Role

The Computational Biology and Bioinformatics team at Hummingbird Biosciences is responsible for guiding strategic decisions in clinical development that are already having a profound impact in the lives of patients. We are looking for a talented intern to help us improve our analytical capabilities through the development of R Shiny Apps. Through the development and improvement of R Shiny Apps, the intern will hold an important role, providing essential data access to the CEO, CSO, CTO, and multiple VPs, thereby influencing the company's decision-making processes.

The Intern Will Have The Opportunity To

 Hone their Shiny App development skills
 Explore data visualization techniques
 Learn commonly used analysis in the biotech industry
 Get exposed to clinical oncology drug development

Key Responsibilities

 Develop R Shiny apps to support drug and clinical development activities of different departments
 Improve/optimize already existing Shiny apps in the organization
 Develop and improve functionality of the tools, such as data summarization, analysis and visualization
 Write clean and maintainable production-level code
 Document and test the changes to the current builds

Requirements And Qualifications

 Currently enrolled in a Bachelor or Master’s Program in Computer Science, Computational Biology or related Science program
 Demonstrated experience developing R shiny apps
 Interest in the clinical development of cancer treatment
 Experience with the configuration of shiny servers is a plus

OUR MISSION & VALUES

Our fast-growing biotechnology company is committed to discovering and developing important new drugs for cancer and autoimmune diseases, and live by our values: Excellence, Determination, Teamwork, Intellectual Integrity and Audacity.

JOIN US AT THE FRONTIER OF DRUG DISCOVERY AND DEVELOPMENT

We are looking for passionate and motivated individuals committed to solving important, complex problems. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to learn from a multi-disciplinary team and work towards transforming the therapeutic landscape for hard-to-treat diseases. We are committed to the personal and professional development of our team and offer robust learning and development programs. Hummingbird Bioscience understands the need for flexibility for our team and offers a generous paid time off program with flexibility to support employees through different life stages. We invest in our team’s health and offer a comprehensive and holistic employee assistance program. We foster a more collaborative, productive, and sociable culture with on-site lunches and snacks. Finally, we believe in creating social impact beyond our business through corporate social responsibility initiatives.

Hummingbird Bioscience is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all Singapore and US federal, state and local laws and/or guidelines that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.
Desired Skills and Experience
Analytical Skills, Interpersonal Skills, app development, coding, Adaptability, Programming and Coding, Communication Skills, Team Player, Software Development, Data Visualisation

name_location: UBISOFT SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  5 days ago  · 32 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Company Description

Ubisoft’s 21,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Since opening its doors in 2008, Ubisoft Singapore has become the biggest AAA game development studio in Southeast Asia. The 500-strong studio is home to 35+ different nationalities focused on delivering ambitious gaming experiences to our players. Ubisoft Singapore has been contributing to all the Assassin’s Creed® titles since Assassin’s Creed® II. It innovated within the franchise as the studio behind the naval battle gameplay and water technology in Assassin’s Creed® III, Assassin’s Creed® IV Black Flag® and most recently in Assassin’s Creed® Valhalla. Its expertise in AAA and live operations, combined with a passion for naval gameplay, pushed the team to lead the development of Skull and Bones™ revealed at E3 in 2017.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will apply your problem-solving and coding skills to enhance the production of our video games through statistical modelling and machine learning algorithms. We need you to become an expert in interpreting complex needs from game development teams and implement efficient and adapted solutions that will benefit the most people.

What You Will Do

In six months:

You will become familiar with the data sources in a AAA game development environment.
You will collaborate with our Data Analysts and production teams to extract the needed data.
You will have worked on small projects to enhance the insights we deliver.

In Twelve Months:

You will have built a solid relationship with key stakeholders and worked closely with them to identify and propose solutions to their needs.
You will be working on complex tools and projects that will help production teams craft video games faster and with more confidence.

After This Period, You Will Be Able To:

Gather needs from production teams and translate them in a solvable problem using data science tools.
Organize and collect data by collaborating with all the necessary teams.
Implement statistical or machine learning models that provide the best results while being cost-efficient.
Develop easy-to-use tools to help development teams craft AAA video games.

Qualifications

Essential:

Up to 2 years experience in a related field (gaming, technology, analytics, data) or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Engineering
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques and concepts (Regression. Clustering, Decision trees, Deep Learning, etc.)
Strong problem-solving skills
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity
Culturally flexible and enjoy working and communicating with different job families (game designers, data analysts, etc.)

Desired:

Work experience with data science projects
Interest in gaming

Essential:

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Proficient in Python
Good knowledge of SQL
Experience with data science frameworks such as PyTorch, Spark ML and scikit-learn
Familiarity with version control systems (git)

Desired:

Knowledge of the Hadoop ecosystem
Familiarity with Linux
Familiarity with web technologies
Familiarity with API development

Additional information

Ubisoft’s 21,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.
Desired Skills and Experience
Video Games, API Development, Machine Learning, Version Control, Game Development, Hadoop, Mathematics, Web Technologies, Titles, PyTorch, SQL, Python, Data Science, IV

name_location: SQKII PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Want to make fun games that give out free money?

We’ve got an opening.

Sqkii is known for our #HuntTheMouse and #HuntFromHome campaigns that give away cold, hard cash to players. In the good old pre-COVID days, our hunts and custom games got Singaporeans squatting in random spots and running after golden eggs. Now, we’re bringing players on a combination of real life adventures and virtual journeys through their mobile screens — they’re still super cool, just ask the mouse.

We paid a virtual visit to the player community in Malaysia at the start of 2021 with #HuntFromHome — Around The World, and oh boy do we have big plans ahead for SEA and beyond. Big plans = bigger team, so we’re on the hunt (ha) for someone who wants to hop onto this thrilling ride.

As our Game Design Intern, you’ll work your magic behind the scenes to bring our current and future games to wild new heights. Fair warning — we’re open to ideas from literally anyone in the team, so you can expect some pretty absurd plans amidst legit game thingamajigs. If you love games, understand games, and can’t wait to create some of the most exciting ones to date, we (and our Game Design team) are 200% ready to meet you.

See below for more details and hit us up for a chat anytime.

P.S. After you’ve applied, we’ll send over some secret tasks for you to try your hand at before we arrange for a virtual chat!

What You’ll Be Doing

Analysing the best games in the industry with comprehensive research methodology and reporting findings to the team
Conceptualising unique and engaging game concepts that can achieve stakeholders’ objectives without compromising on fun
Developing effective game design strategies to attract a hyper casual audience, by applying gamer psychology and human-centered design principles
Performing extensive playtesting at all stages of planning in order to fine-tune game mechanics, balance game economies and observe player behaviours
Working with developers, copywriters, UI/UX designers and other stakeholders to produce high quality games
Crafting carefully considered sketches of game screens

What You’ll Need

To be a current student at local public polytechnics or universities
Strong understanding of game mechanics, gameplay loops and game economy
The ability to translate this knowledge into fun and engaging games
Strong understanding of gamer psychology, motivations, and/or behavioural science.
The ability to translate this knowledge into effective monetisation methodology and synthesise said research into game design insights
Digital illustration skills
Knowledge of industry-standard best-practices to research and analyse games.
Good written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management and organisation abilities
Experience in user experience design would be a plus
Commitment for at least three months, though the internship period is flexible

Desired Skills and Experience
Game Development, Psychology, Game Design, Mobile Games, Gameplay, Research Skills, User Experience Design, Game Mechanics, Time Management, Game Testing, Mobile Game Development, Good Written Communication Skills, Product Development

ALG is currently recruiting Trainee Technicians for our Engine MRO client.

This traineeship is an opportunity for aspiring individuals who are keen to join aviation industry but do not meet the pre-requisites as a trained aircraft engine technician. Upon successful completion of the programme, a career as a qualified aircraft engine technician awaits you.

Job Responsibilities

The programme involves a fully-sponsored training programme with an allowance over the one-year training period.
Upon completion of the training, the qualified aircraft engine technician will serve a two-year or four-year bond.
Career progression opportunity is open to promising technicians.
The programme encompasses initial company familiarisation, classroom training and on-the-job training.
The initial familiarisation provides an insight to the working environment prior to attending classroom training.

The nine-month on-the-job training provides the opportunity to learn and work on the renowned Engines.

name_location: D4L DATA4LIFE ASIA LIMITED · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 128 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Come join our growing team and our mission: Helping researchers to find new treatment methods by providing them with the software they need? Our Singapore team is expanding and there is a lot to learn, discover and contribute.

Develop new software and contribute to existing open source software
Work on an analytical platform which requires sub-second responses to complex queries
Work on applications, which support researchers in improving the treatment of patients
Get in touch with the latest technologies/concepts like Kubernetes and GraphQL
Help to shape the product by bringing in new ideas for features and usage of technologies
Contribute to the automation of the set up and running the platform on Kubernetes and Azure

Who We Are Looking For

Programming skills in at least one programming language e.g. Java, Python or JavaScript/TypeScript
Ideally, you would have experience in developing and operating micro services on e.g. Kubernetes
Experienced in SQL
Ideally experience with cloud providers like AWS or Azure
Experience with Pulumi or Terraform is a plus
2 years of relevant experience, however fresh Computer Science graduates will also be considered
You are a team player who loves to share knowledge and ideas with your colleagues
Strong analytical skills
Fluency in English

Why you will love working with us

Actively contribute to developing digital health solutions with a direct impact on the health and quality of life of others.
Nonprofit work with a purpose: With us, you will find a fulfilling and meaningful task in a nonprofit environment that will advance our society.
A diverse team of professionals from various countries working together from 3 locations (Potsdam, Berlin and Singapore).
Subsidized gym membership to encourage a healthy lifestyle.
A generous education budget of up to S$1500 and 2 education days per year (pro rata depending on your working hours) for courses, books, conferences, and your professional development.
Real Work-Life-Balance with flexible working hours and various work models.
Subsidized home broadband to support home and remote work locations.
Support for your mental health: One-on-one psychological sessions or peer group sessions with Likeminded.
A first-class corporate health insurance that includes dental and maternity coverage.
Subsidized annual check-up, to encourage regular health screening.
Regular knowledge transfer through “all hands”, “town halls” and “Knowledge4Life” events.
Several employee driven initiatives, every new colleague is welcome to participate in (for example the “Climate initiative” or “Diversity, Equality & Inclusion”).
An extensive and detailed on-boarding program to make your start at Data4Life as efficient and smooth as possible

About Us

Data4Life is a nonprofit organization with the vision of making the world a healthier place. With a team from different countries, we work together on the mission to digitize health research. By linking technology and research, we make health data available to research in a comprehensive, digital and secure way. Our interdisciplinary team in Potsdam, Berlin and Singapore brings together experts from fields such as product development, digital engineering, data security and science. Data4Life was founded in 2017 and is funded by the Hasso Plattner Foundation.

We Care About

Diversity: Many different lives, careers, and development paths lead to Data4Life. We welcome experts from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to our international team, offering everyone equal opportunities to be themselves and develop to the best of their abilities. Diversity, equality, and inclusion are not just nice words at Data4Life – we put them into practice in all of our activities and projects, striving to incorporate them in our everyday lives. For this reason, we signed the Charta der Vielfalt (Diversity Charter) in 2022.

The Climate: Data4Life is a member of the Leaders for Climate Action community and climate neutral since 2019.
Desired Skills and Experience
Terraform, Lifestyle, Scalability, Kubernetes, Analytical Skills, Azure, Open Source Software, AWS, TypeScript, GraphQL, JavaScript, SQL, Python, Team Player, Java

name_location: HASHSTACS PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  4 days ago  · 22 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Company Description

STACS (Hashstacs Pte Ltd) is a Singapore-headquartered FinTech company focused on ESG FinTech, operating ESGpedia, which powers the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s (MAS) Greenprint ESG Registry. STACS serves as the Nexus of ESG Finance with ESG data across multiple industries and digital tools for the financial sector to scale decarbonisation financing, as well as a platform to provide high-quality carbon offsets to mitigate residual emissions. Its clients and partners include global financial institutions and corporates.

STACS is an Award Winner of the MAS Global FinTech Innovation Challenge Awards 2020, and a two-time awardee of the Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) Proof of Concept (POC) grant, under the Financial Sector Development Fund administered by the MAS.

Job Summary

We are looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer Intern to join our rapidly expanding Engineering team who is passionate about designing and building products. You will work in a cross disciplinary setting with both product owners and seasoned engineers to provide our Enterprise clients an intuitive user experience that assists them in completing functional workloads on our ESG platform.

The ideal candidate is a hands-on full stack engineer who has had exposure to the traditional Enterprise application UI and a strong background in Java having worked with many types of RESTful APIs. You will have the opportunity to design and implement new applications for the capital markets and ESG (green financing) sector. You should also have a strong background in web security and role based access control. You can expect to work with many Cloud-based tools (AWS Cloud) and be open to learning new tools. You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with little supervision in an Agile environment.

Job Responsibilities

As a Full Stack Software Engineer Intern, you will be responsible for designing and implementing web-based applications to drive efficiency and productivity of our clients on the ESG platform.

Your Core Responsibilities

 Design and implement frontend services using React.JS framework
 Implement code with the latest web security best practices
 Able to analyze requirements and use them to design and develop functional products
 Designing and implementing Java code for a modern cloud-based environment using Object Oriented Programming principles
 Implement and interface with REST APIs with Java
 Design and interface with relational databases such as MySQL and noSQL databases such as DynamoDB
 Work with a cross disciplinary team to build a great product

Requirements

B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent degree or experience
UX Design experience is a plus
Relevant work experience with React.js and Java applications
 Prior experience with relational databases (e.g. MySQL)
 Familiarity with site performance tuning, concurrency handling and caching mechanisms
 Familiar with browser debugging and testing
Experience with 1 or more cloud platforms is a plus

What You Will Need To Thrive

 Value teamwork above all.
 Natural curiosity to learn.
 Loves to work with code.
 Intrinsically motivated personality.
 High adaptability and strong problem-solving skills.
 Customer focused mindset.
 Self-starter who thrives on complexity and independence.

Intern Experience Sharing

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PDNAHrfoCKI

Notice

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. All applications will be treated with strictest confidence.

By submitting any application or resume to us, you will be deemed to have read and agreed to the terms of our Privacy Policy(https://stacs.io/privacy-policy/), and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.

You may refer and access our website(https://stacs.io/) for more information.
Desired Skills and Experience
REST, UX Design, MySQL, Agile, JavaScript, DynamoDB, UI, Access Control, Capital Markets, Adaptability, Web Security, Performance Tuning, Java, Debugging, UX, Databases

name_location: Ubisoft · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 87 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Ubisoft’s 21,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Since opening its doors in 2008, Ubisoft Singapore has become the biggest AAA game development studio in Southeast Asia. The 500-strong studio is home to 35+ different nationalities focused on delivering ambitious gaming experiences to our players. Ubisoft Singapore has been contributing to all the Assassin’s Creed® titles since Assassin’s Creed® II. It innovated within the franchise as the studio behind the naval battle gameplay and water technology in Assassin’s Creed® III, Assassin’s Creed® IV Black Flag® and most recently in Assassin’s Creed® Valhalla. Its expertise in AAA and live operations, combined with a passion for naval gameplay, pushed the team to lead the development of Skull and Bones™ revealed at E3 in 2017.

Job Description

As a Data Engineer, you will develop robust data pipelines processing millions of in-game data points daily using Big Data technology. You will collaborate closely with our data engineers/analysts/scientists and the Ubisoft data platform team, ensuring efficient and reliable processing of the information collected. Your role is essential in our video games' development and maintenance life cycle. Deriving insights from data will help our production teams deliver a better experience to our players.

What You Will Do

In three months:

You will be familiar with the global services, tools, and processes used to collect in-game data at large at Ubisoft;
You will be familiar with the actual ETL pipelines put in place by our teams to derive in-game metrics at Ubisoft Singapore;
You will understand essential business metrics for AAA games and how that impacts our pipelines. 

In six months:

You will be maintaining and monitoring our ETL pipelines to ensure high data availability;
You will have implemented flows to capture new information;
You will have contributed to our web platform by working alongside our web developer to provide easy access to our data;
You will have built a solid relationship with our data analysts and worked alongside them to deliver insights timely. 

In twelve months:

You will work with the global Ubisoft Data Platform team to keep our practices up to date;
You will have improved the efficiency and scalability of our data pipelines by implementing the latest recommended tools and methodologies;
You will have implemented monitoring and testing tools to react quickly when our complex flows break due to changes. 

After this period,you will be able to:

Have a very strong understanding of Ubisoft data ecosystems;
Make changes to our data pipelines autonomously to improve their efficiency, scalability and usability;
Deploy new tools to make your life easier and ensure high availability;
Have an effective work relationship with all teams mentioned and contact them as needed;
Become the gatekeeper of Ubisoft Singapore data pipelines

Qualifications

Essential:

Up to 2 years experience in a related field (gaming, advertising, analytics, technology, data, or business intelligence) or Master's degree in Software Development and/or Data Engineering-related field
Very good understanding of Data Warehouses
Proficient in writing efficient SQL queries
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python preferred)
Culturally flexible and enjoy working and communicating with teams from across different countries

Desired:

Work experience with Big Data ecosystems (Spark, Hive, Airflow, etc.)
Experience with containerization (docker)
Familiarity with Linux system administration
Familiarity with a version control system (git)
Interest in gaming

Additional Information

Ubisoft’s 21,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Responsibilities And Tasks

 Model, build, and test AI systems with large swaths of data, ensuring high performance, stability, with desired accuracy.
 Integrate various machine learning models and algorithms into backend systems to address business problems, such as recommendation systems, predictive analytics, computer vision model etc.
 Optimize and fine-tune systems to improve the performance and efficiency of AI models.
 Design and implement APIs and microservices to make AI functionality accessible via RESTful interfaces.
 Research and evaluate new AI technologies and tools to continuously enhance the system architecture.
 Write clear documentation to record the design, implementation, and usage of AI systems / tools.
 Work with a team of machine-learning and data engineers to ensure seamless AI development and integration.
 Collect, organize, and present progress with team leadership and stakeholders.

About Up Devlabs

UP Devlabs deals with all forms of software development, maintenance and data analytics. The company also covers a wide spectrum of activities and specializations, catering to different clientele and venturing into different markets with emerging technological advances. Our clients are spread across the Asia Pacific regions, including China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore and Japan, and also in Europe, South America and Africa regions.

Qualifications And Skills Requirements

 Strong data processing and data engineering skills, capable of handling large-scale datasets.
 Deep understanding of data science, linear algebra, algorithms, and statistics.
 Proficiency in the Python programming language and familiarity with relevant Python libraries and frameworks.
 Proficiency in microservice development (e.g Golang) would be a plus

Backend development experience with knowledge of database systems (such as SQL and NoSQL), as well as web development and API design would be a plus

 Willingness to learn and continue developing knowledge in an up-and-coming field.
 Knowledge of transformer-based models and experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Pytorch etc would be a plus

Familiarity with developing and deploying within a cloud based infrastructure and services environment a plus

 Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to thrive in a demanding, fast-paced work environment.
 Strong interpersonal and communication skills and a willingness to collaborate cross-functionally with different teams.

UP-SGDS-ASE-20231004
Desired Skills and Experience
TensorFlow, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Computer Vision, Data Engineering, PyTorch, SQL, Team Leadership, Python, API, Python Programming, System Architecture, Catering, Web Development, Linear Algebra, Software Development

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
You will report to the Principal Investigator (PI) and assists the PI to achieve research goals by executing research support excellently, efficiently and with empathy.

Your Key Responsibilities Include

To assist Principal Investigator and collaborators on research projects, including establishing SOPs, literature search and review, designing projects, performing experiments and data analysis etc.
To collaborate as Co-Principal Investigator and secure competitive external and internal research grant as Principal Investigator.
To provide necessary assistance in the operation and maintenance of multiple imaging research databases in compliance with prevailing legal regulations and institutional rules, and core research equipment and facilities.
To provide some scientific advice and support on research methodology and techniques to the research team for analytics of structured and image based data.
To act as the trusted third party to de-identify patient data for research
To perform statistical analysis of data, and facilitate data visualisation and analytics
To prepare reports and/or presentations to communicate findings of image based and other research analysis to internal/external stakeholders

Job Requirements

Bachelor Degree or Master in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Vision or other related disciplines, ideally with working experience
Proficiency in using R/Python, Tableau or OBIEE, and SPSS or Stata
Experience in handling/processing/manipulation/analytics, ideally of both structured and non-structured image based data
Meticulous with an eye for details
Able to work independently and in a team.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Resourceful, innovative, and creative in problem solving
Working knowledge of research process and medical terminologies is an advantage
Publication track record as first or last author in relevant field
Prior working experience in research laboratories
Fully vaccinated against COVID-19

name_location: SQKII PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Want to design fun games that give out free money?

We’ve got an opening.

Sqkii is known for our #HuntTheMouse and #HuntFromHome campaigns that give away cold, hard cash to players. In the good old pre-COVID days, our hunts and custom games got Singaporeans squatting in random spots and running after golden eggs. Now, we’re bringing players on a combination of real life adventures and virtual journeys through their mobile screens — they’re still super cool, just ask the mouse.

We paid a virtual visit to the player community in Malaysia at the start of 2021 with #HuntFromHome — Around The World, and oh boy do we have big plans ahead for SEA and beyond. Big plans = bigger team, so we’re on the hunt (ha) for someone who wants to hop onto this thrilling ride.

As our Game Design (UX) Intern, you’ll work your magic behind-the-scenes to bring our current and future games to wild new heights. Fair warning — we’re open to ideas from literally anyone in the team, so you can expect some pretty absurd plans amidst legit game thingamajigs. If you love games, understand games, and can’t wait to create some of the most exciting ones to date, we (and our Game Operations team) are 200% ready to meet you.

See below for more details and hit us up for a chat anytime.

P.S. After you’ve applied, we’ll send over some secret tasks for you to try your hand at before we arrange for a virtual chat!

What You’ll Be Doing

Performing in-depth research in order to create effective user personas, information architecture and user journeys
Tackling clients’ product requirements with comprehensive UX design strategies, by applying gamer psychology and human-centred design principles
Producing high quality UX design work, including, user flow diagrams, site maps, wireframes and prototypes (both in paper & digital formats)
Conveying your vision for the final digital product through sketches, storyboards and mood boards
Working closely with game designers, developers, copywriters, UI designers and other stakeholders to produce high-quality games
Crafting carefully considered sketches of game screens
(Bonus) Conducting tests for digital products at all stages of planning in order to analyse and predict user behaviour

What You’ll Need

To be a current student at local public polytechnics or universities
Digital illustration skills
Knowledge of UX processes and usability design principles
Strong understanding of hierarchy and layout design principles
Understanding of game navigation and common UI patterns
The ability to synthesise user research into UX design insights
Good written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management and organisation abilities
Experience in game design would be a plus
Commitment for at least three months, though the internship period is flexible

Desired Skills and Experience
Wireframes, Producing, Psychology, Game Theory, Game Design, Mobile Games, Digital Illustration, User Experience Design, Attention to Detail, Time Management, User Research, Game Testing, Mobile Game Development, Good Written Communication Skills, Product Development

job_description:
About the job
Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

Responsibilities:

Consulting with managers to determine and refine machine learning objectives. 
Working with the Software team and Product Owner for Designing machine learning systems and self-running artificial intelligence (AI) software to automate predictive models. 
Transforming data science prototypes and applying appropriate ML algorithms and tools. 
Ensuring that algorithms generate accurate user recommendations. 
Turning unstructured data into useful information by auto-tagging images and text-to-speech conversions. 
Developing ML algorithms to analyze huge volumes of historical data to make predictions. 
Running tests, performing statistical analysis, and interpreting test results. 

Requirements:

Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field. 
Knowledge in computational linguistics, data analytics, or similar will be advantageous. 
Proficiency with Python, Java, or R code writing. 
Knowledge of ML frameworks, libraries, data structures, data modeling, and software architecture. 
Knowledge of mathematics, statistics, and algorithms. 
Analytical and problem-solving abilities. 
Great communication and collaboration skills. 
Good in time management and organizational abilities. 

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Company Description

Ubisoft’s 21,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Since opening its doors in 2008, Ubisoft Singapore has become the biggest AAA game development studio in Southeast Asia. The 500-strong studio is home to 35+ different nationalities focused on delivering ambitious gaming experiences to our players. Ubisoft Singapore has been contributing to all the Assassin’s Creed® titles since Assassin’s Creed® II. It innovated within the franchise as the studio behind the naval battle gameplay and water technology in Assassin’s Creed® III, Assassin’s Creed® IV Black Flag® and most recently in Assassin’s Creed® Valhalla. Its expertise in AAA and live operations, combined with a passion for naval gameplay, pushed the team to lead the development of Skull and Bones™ revealed at E3 in 2017.

Job Description

Role Summary

The AI programmer is responsible for game elements not controlled by the player (ex: NPC/enemy actions and behaviours) that enrich the overall game experience.

Responsibilities

Collect, interpret and analyze the technical feasibility of AI specifications
Analyze and determine if current AI functionalities in the game engine meet the project’s AI requirements
Suggest technical improvements while designing and implementing new AI systems
Collaborate with designers to discuss technical constraints and establish technical solutions for varying AI functionalities
Propose technical innovations inspired by industry leaders
Write clear and well structured C++ code while bearing in mind performance, maintenance and compatibility requirements
Verify and validate that newly developed systems conform to the project’s AI goals without negatively affecting existing code

Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
A minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience programming AI for video games or related disciplines
Exposure in working with gaming at any level
Desirable experience working on AAA titles, current and next-gen consoles (not essential)
The ability to support AI functionalities and systems designed for the production
Find and fix AI bugs flagged by Quality Control and team members from other disciplines
Document work to transfer system knowledge allowing users to understand the use of new AI functionalities
Perform all other related tasks
Analytical and logical
Ability to solve complex problems
Ability to take initiative & keen sense of detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Team-oriented & Results driven

Additional information

Ubisoft’s 21,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

name_location: Syfe · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 41 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Syfe

Syfe is a digital investment platform with a mission to empower people to grow their money confidently, and choose the future they want to live. Built on the pillars of advice, access and innovation, we cater to the full spectrum of an individual's wealth needs across diversified proprietary portfolios, cash management solutions and a state-of-the-art brokerage.

The Syfe team combines world-class financial expertise with best in-class technology talent. Excellence in execution is in our DNA and we offer equity ownership to all employees regardless of seniority and designation.

We are regulated by the financial authorities across Singapore, Hong Kong and Australia. In Singapore alone, where we are headquartered, over 100,000 investors trust Syfe to grow their wealth.

Since its founding, Syfe has raised US $52.4 million from world-class investors. The company has won multiple awards including Wealth Management Fintech of the Year by the Asian Banking and Finance Awards 2022, as well as being recognized as one of the Top LinkedIn Startups in Singapore 2022 and 2023.

Find out more about us at www.syfe.com.

Press links - Bloomberg, Business Times, TechCrunch

The Right Profile

We are looking to hire an Operations Analyst Trainee who will be joining an expanding team covering new products & processes. As a successful hire, you will be involved in the day to day operations of the company, and your inputs will help to shape the future of Syfe. You will be responsible for learning processes around our various business operations, ensuring trades, corporate actions, payments & funding are processed in an accurate & timely manner. You will learn and perform reconciliations to verify our books and records with our external vendors. You will be expected to assess and enhance existing processes to drive continuous improvement and efficiency.

Responsibilities
Work within a high performing operations team
Manage day-to-day trade processing, settlement, corporate actions processing & overall reconciliation
Conduct due diligence on new and existing clients while reviewing client documentation. Escalate and document potential KYC issues while working closely with the AML team
Develop & maintain vendor and inter-department relationships
Identify process improvements & implement required enhancements 

Minimum Qualifications & Skill Sets
Candidates with no experience and diploma holders are welcome to apply
Great interest in the investment and financial markets industry
Meticulous, with an eye on detail as well as excellent time management skills
Proven ability to adapt, learn, and problem solve in a fast-paced environment
Able to work well in a team
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, VBAs and having a talent with numbers

name_location: PIEZO SMART PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
About The Company

Piezo Smart is an innovative start-up company in Singapore (spin off from A*STAR). Our mission is to create cutting-edge intelligent technology enabled by smart material functions that help our customers aware of and understand state of happening. We specialize in design and development of advanced piezoelectric materials, electromechanical sensors and transducers, and in providing solutions for various industries, including internet of things (IoT) sensors for personal health monitoring, traffic monitoring, and industrial IoT sensors for structural health monitoring (refer to www. piezo-smart.com). Candidates with passion in creating ground-breaking intelligent technology and generating tangible impact are welcome to join us.

Job Requirements

 Polytechnic or bachelor degree in science or engineering, or equivalent qualification
 Passion in research and development work; Keen to learn and adapt to new technologies
 Knowledge on piezoelectrics, experience in materials and sensor technology would be advantageous but not a must
 Ability to work with minimized supervision
 Good communication skills in English and Chinese
 Fresh graduates and candidates with no prior work experience are encouraged to apply

Key Responsibilities

As a R&D Engineer at Piezo Smart, your primary responsibilities will include:

 Collaborating with A*STAR research team to understand and apply technologies related to piezoelectric materials, sensors, and transducers
 Participating in the preparation and characterization of piezoelectric materials
 Fabrication and testing of smart sensors and transducers
 Contributing to the applicational development of new materials, sensors, transducers, and systems
 Documenting and presenting research findings and developments to stakeholders
 Assisting in the transfer of technology from the research lab to commercial applications.

This position is open exclusively to Singaporean citizens, with the office located in the one-north area.

Salary

We offer a competitive salary package ranging from 3500 to 4500 SGD monthly, depending on the candidate's qualifications and experience. A performance-based bonus is also included in the remuneration package.

For interested applicants, please send your resume to contact@piezo-smart.com
Desired Skills and Experience
Machine Learning, Product Design, Hardware, Fabrication, Reliability, Characterization, Packaging, Sensors, Product Development, IC, Manufacturing, ANSYS

We Are Caring is a globally-leading social impact organisation focused on ensuring the ethical recruitment of Migrant Domestic Workers (MDWs), supported by the DBS Foundation. job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Job Title

Data Analyst

Job Description

Do you like to take an extra step, analyzing the root cause of a failed software component or interface, and providing solutions for the cause?

Vanderlande understands the complexities associated with a successful airport and parcel operation and delivers future-proof logistic process automation. These automation systems are composed of many Electromechanical, IT, and control components that require expert knowledge to support.

The Data Analyst plays a crucial role in optimizing and enhancing the efficiency and performance of the baggage handling system at the Airport. This position involves analyzing data, identifying process improvement opportunities, and implementing solutions to streamline baggage handling operations.

Key Responsibilities

Collect and analyze operational data related to baggage handling processes.
Identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement in the system's performance.
Utilize statistical methods and data visualization tools to present findings.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess current baggage handling processes.
Communicate performance status and improvement actions internally and with customers.
Develop and communicate business cases for improvements.
Develop and implement process improvement strategies and workflows.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Implement monitoring systems to track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to baggage handling.
Proactively identify issues and areas requiring immediate attention.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of processes, improvements, and data analysis.
Generate regular reports on system performance and improvement initiatives.
Train staff on new processes and best practices.
Promote a culture of continuous improvement and data-driven decision-making.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Information Technology, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field of study.
Preferred relevant working experience in logistics or technical environment.
3 + years of relevant working experience in industrial systems.
Proven experience in data analysis, process engineering, or a similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, and SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Tableau and/or Splunk knowledge preferred
Excellent communication and presentation skills (customer-facing role).
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Desired Skills and Experience
Tableau, Process Automation, Microsoft Excel, Data Analysis, Ability To Work Independently, Process Improvement, Customerfacing, Mathematics, Baggage Handling System, Industrial Engineering, Information Technology, Process Engineering, Data Migration, Python, Presentation Skills, Data Science, Baggage Handling Operations, Databases, Linux, Data Visualization

name_location: VISASQ SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 39 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
About VisasQ

VisasQ is the leading Expert Network Service (ENS) company in Japan that operates a knowledge platform that promotes innovation across the globe by connecting more than 580,000 experts in 190 countries. We established seven global offices in Japan (Tokyo), the U.S.(New York, California, North Carolina, Phoenix), Singapore, Hong Kong, and the U.K. (London) with more than 500 employees.

In March 2020, VisasQ became a listed company on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, and in November 2021, we acquired Coleman Research Group, a leading U.S. ENS company.

By showing our strong presence in APAC region, VisasQ was awarded "Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Asia Pacific" twice in a row in 2019 and 2020. Eiko Hashiba, CEO & founder of VisasQ has also been selected as one of Asia's Power Businesswomen 2021 by Forbes.

As we are scaling up our operations in Singapore, we are looking for like-minded business builders and colleagues to join us in this exciting journey!

The Research Associate role at VisasQ is one that puts you right at the forefront of global business intelligence and knowledge sharing. You will be our clients’ trusted partner to help fulfil their market intelligence and research needs by connecting them with high quality subject matter experts located anywhere in the world. If you are energized and excited by the opportunity to interact and work with the world’s top institutional investors, consulting firms and corporations, then do read on below!

The most successful Research Associates are those who have an extraordinary ability to:

Source, discern, process and clearly communicate (verbally and written) information and ideas
Manage multiple time-sensitive and evolving priorities
Take a versatile approach to problem solving
See both the forest and the trees
Achieve targets by optimising resources and positively motivating teammates
Consistently live out positive work ethics

Here’s What We Value

Teamwork
Humility and teachability
Authenticity
Tenacity
Respect

As you will be liaising directly with Indonesian/ Mandarin / Thai / Korean stakeholders, fluency (both verbal and written) in Indonesian / Mandarin / Thai / Korean is essential.

If this gets your heart pumping, then you may be a great fit for this role and we’d love to chat with you!

One more thing...if we do shortlist you for a chat, please be prepared to share with us:

What you know about the industry we are in
What’s unique about VisasQ?
What you think this role entails
How your strengths will contribute to your success in this role
What are the challenges you think you will face

Fresh graduates are welcomed to apply.
Desired Skills and Experience
Negotiation, Teamwork, Business Intelligence, Interpersonal Skills, Critical Thinking, Recruiting, Problem Solving, Project Management, Attention to Detail, Networking, Time Management, Market Intelligence, Communication Skills, Consulting, Customer Service, Screening, Stakeholder Management, Sourcing, Research

About the job
If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, and you are missing out on the skills to work in your dream job, this bootcamp is for you. Get trained and work on hands-on projects in our bootcamp to upskill yourself!

and many more exciting projects

8 hours training by experienced product managers incl. guest speakers from Europe

– CI/CD pipelines and many more

– Cover letter preparation

– Interview tips

Why join our Java Backend Developer Training Program?

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Number of opening : 1

Internship duration : Jan to Jun 2024

Who We Are

Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Banking (CA-CIB) is the CIB arm of Crédit Agricole Group, world’s 11th largest bank by total assets.

Our Singapore Center Is One Of The 3 Main IT Hubs For CA-CIB's Worldwide Business. We Work Daily With International Branches Located In 33 Countries By

 Envisioning and preparing the Bank’s futures information systems
 Partnering and supporting core banking flagships and transverse areas in their large scale development projects.
 Providing premium In-house Banking applications,

This unique positioning empowers us to bring our core banking business a sustainable competitive advantage on the market.

We seek innovative and agile people sharing our mindset to support ambitious and forthcoming technological challenges.

The Department and position

The department is responsible for development and maintenance of Capital Market applications used by worldwide users.

The candidate will be involved with many front line IT professionals who understand the nature of business operations, timing of activities & data flowing through internal and external systems. The candidate will also be in touch with business users, infrastructure engineer and system managers.

The candidate will join the Singapore Capital Market investment group in charge of running “Summit” applications for dervivative asset classes.The team works closely with other teams supporting Front-Office applications (Orchestrade…), Back-Office applications (Calypso,SIS…), Market data referentials and Market Risk applications.

Mission

As an intern, your mission is to become a valuable asset to our organization by:

 Interacting Comfortably with People: Building strong collaborative relationships within the team and stakeholders.
 Automation and Development: Demonstrating a deep passion for development, specially in Technologies: C#, Shell Scripting, PL/SQL, SQL

Database: Sybase, Oracle

Browser Automation: UI Automation Client/Selenium

BDD Framework: Nunit

Source Code/Lifecycle Management: SVN/GIT, Jenkins, Gitlab, Ansible, MasterDeploy

Interest in Bank activities: Apetite to understand the business activities of the bank on Capital Markets.
Process automation: Appetite for continuous improvement and automation. Of new as well as existing process to enhance efficiency and reduce the TAT.
During your internship, you will have the opportunity to:
Learn about Global Market Front Office activities, Financial Data, Transaction Reporting, Market Data, Risk Indicators and Regulaotry requirements – opportunity to learn end-to-end invensment banking workflow.
On the job training to directly apply your learning and be impactful.
Gain insights into Software Development, understand the SDLC and its real-life implementation.
Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts, including Business Analysts, Support Analysts, Developers, DevOps Engineers, and Quality Software Developers.
Benefit from the guidance of a dedicated mentor.
Deliver on jobs that directly impact the banks day-to-day activities and witness the added value of your job directly from business lines.

Qualifications And Profile

Candidates should have:

C# programming language
SQL, PL/SQL and UNIX/LINUX Scripting skills.
Excellent Aptitude, Curious to learn and inquisitive.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Autonomous, self motivated and excellent team player.
Fluency in English - as acting in a multi-cultural environment.

The scope will be adapted depending on the situation and the progress of the trainee.

Education & Work Experience

Bachelor’/ Master’s degree in Computers Science/IT or equivalent domain.

Shift Timings

Asia shift works from 9am to 6:30pm SGT.

Application Process

Interested students will need to apply via below link

https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=o0Vvofwy&s=URL

Interested students will need to complete an aptitude/personality test during the application process.

Market Risk, Process Automation, Oracle, Investment Banking, Agile, Scripting, UI, Test Automation, SQL, C Shell, Selenium, Ansible, UI Automation, C#, Software Development

name_location: Univers · Singapore, Singapore  1 week ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Univers provides the world’s most comprehensive decarbonization system. 

We help companies and countries optimize energy systems and reduce carbon emissions with accurate, reliable, and actionable decarbonization data. Our EnOS (Energy and Environment Operating System) platform connects on-the-ground operational technology and in-the-cloud intelligence to deliver real-time energy data and data-driven carbon monitoring, reporting, and abatement.

With 220 million sensors and smart devices connected, 550GW of renewable energy under management, and a community of over 500 customers, we’re helping the world’s leading businesses get the world to net zero—and what comes after it.

For more information, please visit https://univers.com/

Product Security Intern

Overview:

Univers's Cyber Security organization is growing rapidly to help guide the company through its own global hyper growth phase. This growth is fueled by customer demand for our innovative cloud-based software and embedded product lines. As a Product Security Intern, you will focus and work along the line of product security to support our solutions including Cloud platform, Edge devices and server infrastructure, with an emphasis on threats from all sources.

Responsibilities: 
Learn and work on threat modeling to support both our Cloud Platform and IoT Edge teams as part of our Secure Development Lifecycle and products.
Help develop and build security utilities and tools that will enable Envision Digital to operate more securely.
Developing secure hardening baselines through scripting.
Experiment and work on innovative technologies such as PUF (Physically Unclonable Feature) on the possibility of incorporating them as part of security features.

name_location: Canonical · Singapore, Singapore  2 weeks ago  · 98 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do

Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events

Who you are

You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an experienced Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

Our Mission is “Partnering You in Organisation Growth through Culture Transformation”.

Through our work with each organisation, we strive to effect transformation, even when the change starts with something small. This is the “Butterfly Effect” - the idea that small, seemingly trivial events may ultimately result in something with much larger consequences.

If you are aligned to our purpose of facilitating change and transformation in organisations for growth, join our team and come build your future with us!

We are proud to be awarded the Tripartite Alliance Award 2021 for Fair and Progressive Employment Practices and Work-life Excellence.

job_description:
About the job
Job Roles And Responsibilities

Mandatory Skills: Kotlin and Java
Java programming skills: Knowing Java is essential for becoming an Android developer.
XML: XML is used for constructing layouts for Android apps and, therefore, must be mastered by any aspiring Android developer.
Knowledge of Android SDK: Every Android developer should understand the core components of the Android SDK, such as Activities, Services, Content Providers, Broadcast Receivers, and Intents.
Familiarity with Android Studio: Android Studio is the official Integrated Development Environment (IDE) for Android development, and all developers should be familiar with it.
Understanding of design guidelines: Every Android developer should understand the design guidelines for Android, which focus on providing an intuitive user experience.
Testing: Knowing how to test apps for different versions of Android is an essential skill for any Android developer.
Version control systems: Many Android developers use version control systems, such as Git, to manage their code.
Collaborative work: Android developers should be able to work collaboratively with other developers, designers, and stakeholders.
Strong proficiency in Kotlin programming language and its features, including coroutines, extension functions, and higher-order functions.
Experience with Kotlin's null safety features, such as nullable types and safe calls, to write safer and more robust code.
Knowledge of Kotlin's interoperability with Java, including the ability to work with existing Java codebases and libraries.
Familiarity with Kotlin Android Extensions or Jetpack View Binding for simplifying view handling and reducing boilerplate code.
